docs.lead_paragraph: The government announced it was giving people two more days to sign up for 2016 health coverage through the federal marketplace. Enrollment was to have ended Tuesday night.

headline.main: Health Insurance Enrollment Deadline Is Extended to Thursday
headline.print_headline: Deadline Passes for Enrolling in Health Insurance

docs.lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said on Tuesday that its so-called core Consumer Price Index, which excludes food and energy, gained 0.2 percent last month, as it did in September and October.

headline.main: Core Inflation Ticks Up, Though Energy Prices Remain Low
headline.print_headline: Energy Prices Remain Low, but Inflation Is Ticking Up

docs.abstract: Labor Dept says its core Consumer Price Index rose 0.2 percent in November, matching September and October increases.
docs.snippet: The Labor Department said on Tuesday that its so-called core Consumer Price Index, which excludes food and energy, gained 0.2 percent last month, as it did in September and October.

docs.lead_paragraph: The package would delay a planned tax on high-cost health insurance plans, suspend a tax on medical devices and expand aid for 9/11 responders.

headline.main: House Reaches Accord on Spending and Tax Cuts
headline.print_headline: Parties Reach House Deal on Spending and Tax Breaks

docs.abstract: House Republicans and Democrats, approaching midnight deadline, reach agreement on $1.1 trillion omnibus spending bill and large package of tax breaks; lawmakers report approved package will  include reauthorization and expansion of James Zagroda 9-11 Health and Compensation Act, providing aid for Sept 11 first responders suffering from diseases related to terrorist attacks.
docs.snippet: The package would delay a planned tax on high-cost health insurance plans, suspend a tax on medical devices and expand aid for 9/11 responders.

keywords.value: James Zadroga 9-11 Health and Compensation Act

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical company’s agreement appeared to be part of its strategy to replace its reliance on a now-defunct mail-order pharmacy.

headline.main: Valeant Makes Distribution Deal With Walgreens
headline.print_headline: Valeant Makes Distribution Deal With Walgreens and Will Reduce Price of Some Drugs

docs.abstract: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International agrees to distribute many of its drugs through Walgreens stores, with some at lower prices.
docs.snippet: The pharmaceutical company’s agreement appeared to be part of its strategy to replace its reliance on a now-defunct mail-order pharmacy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says consumers will have two more days to sign up for HealthCare.gov coverage that takes effect Jan. 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional negotiators on Tuesday wrapped up a sprawling deal to keep the U.S. government operating through next September, while setting new policies ranging from repealing a 40-year-old ban on oil exports to making many business tax breaks permanent, according to Republican lawmakers.

headline.main: Congress Negotiators Get Tax, Spending Deal: Lawmakers
headline.print_headline: Congress Negotiators Get Tax, Spending Deal: Lawmakers

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. consumer prices were unchanged in November as declines in energy and food held down overall costs. But core inflation was up 2 percent over the 12 months ending in November. That was the fastest pace in more than a year and the kind of increase Fed officials want to see to justify the start of a round of interest rate increases.

headline.main: US Consumer Prices Unchanged but Core Inflation Up
headline.print_headline: US Consumer Prices Unchanged but Core Inflation Up

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama, who made few friends in corporate board rooms early in his first term as he pressed for tighter regulations on banks and remarked on the "fat cats" who helped precipitate the financial crisis, heads into his final year in the White House having built – or rebuilt – alliances with chief executives of the nation's biggest companies.

headline.main: Obama Opens White House Doors to Forge CEO Alliances
headline.print_headline: Obama Opens White House Doors to Forge CEO Alliances
